#type:		unclassified
#specification:	Rongorongo (rrg)
#scriptcode:	Latn
#source:	Barthel (1958). Grundlagen zur Entzifferung der Osterinselschrift. Anhandlungen aus dem Gebiet der Auslandskunde, Band 64. Hamburg: CRAM, DE GRUYTER & CO.
#encoding:	utf-8
#copyright:	NA
#comments:	Transcription of inscriptions found on the Easter Islands (here: Tablet A "Tahua"). The signs are transcribed as numbers (see p. 40f. for classifications and further information). Letters "a-e" or "V" indicate a variant of the sign, "D" indicates a derivate, "x" indicates that the sign is depicted upside down compared to it's regular variant, "y" indicates that the line of sight is reversed compared to it's regular variant, "f" indicates that the outline of the regular shape is crossed by several lines, "UNC" indicates unsecurity, "XXX" indicates indecipherable passages, dots between numbers indicate ligations. Line breaks indicate a new line on the "document".

<Aa1>	430.40 320.9 320.9 440 440 440 440 445 695 4.XXX.4 67 34 60 260 554 22f 551'71 22f 552 22f 551 22f 301.8 22f 8 451 22f 5.8 22f 8.6 22f 8 4.64 22f 553 22f 65.3 65.3 65.95 65 65 22f 65 1 65 22 65.450y 65.9 65.6 4 4 4 7 2 60 93 70 200 394 8 1.8 430.V739 300 445 63 385 15f 744 XXX XXX 25 301 27 630.XXX 745.52x 67 XXX 44 2 420 290.401 UNC 658 200.95UNC 670 711.2 741 1.6 376 539a 734UNC 44UNC
